title: Meta's AI system Llama approved for use by US government agencies
description: U.S. government agencies will be able to use Meta Platforms' artificial intelligence system Llama, a senior administration official said, as the Trump administration pushes to integrate commercial AI tools into government operations.
content:
The General Services Administration, the government's purchasing arm, will add Llama to its list of approved AI tools for federal agencies, said Josh Gruenbaum, the GSA's procurement lead, in an interview ahead of announcing the initiative.

content:
New Delhi, Sep 22 Worldwide spending on artificial intelligence (AI) is expected to be nearly $1.5 trillion in 2025, up nearly 50 per cent up from $987,904 in 2024, a report said on Monday.

title: In a first, scientists create AI virus to hunt down harmful bacteria
description: Scientists have for the first time used artificial intelligence to design viruses capable of killing harmful bacteria. In a major leap for computational biology, researchers at Stanford University and the Arc Institute built the world’s first fully AI-generated genome.
content:
In a first-of-its-kind breakthrough, scientists have used artificial intelligence to design viruses—bacteriophages—that can hunt down and kill harmful bacteria.
Researchers at Stanford University and the Arc Institute created the world’s first entire... [2016 chars]

title: Oscar-winning actor wants his own private ChatGPT-like LLM: Matthew McConaughey shares unique AI vision for the future
description: Matthew McConaughey has shared a unique vision for artificial intelligence: a private language model built solely on his writings, journals, books, and personal notes. Speaking on Joe Rogans PowerfulJRE podcast, the actor described it as an “aspirational self,” a digital tool for reflection rather than productivity. Unlike conventional chatbots, his AI would act as a memory vault, helping him rediscover forgotten ideas, explore beliefs, and engage in self-discovery through his own collected wisdom.
content:

title: Instagram tests AI to detect Canadian teens signed up for adult accounts
description: Instagram is testing artificial intelligence in Canada that will identify accounts it suspects belong to teens, even if they list an adult birthday.
